acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96-hour LC50=1.2microg/L of Crustacea  (Glass shrimp) (HSDB, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Rat dermal LD50 = 27mg/kg (RTECS (2003)). Rabbit dermal LD50 = 1270mg/kg (RTECS (2003)). The lower one (LD50 = 27 mg/kg) was adopted, and it was set as Category 1.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat oral LD50 values : 6.8mg/kg (RTECS(2003)) and 20mg/kg (HSDB (2003)), we adopted the lower value to classify the substance as Category 2.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity is Category 1, supposed not rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and bioaccumulative (log Kow=5.33 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Although HSDB (2003) has the description "it has no corrosion behavior," it is not clear whether the description is applied to metal. Since data is insufficient, it cannot be classified.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Although it is flammable (ICSC (J), 1997), there is almost no vapor pressure (ICSC (J), 1997). And PM (13th, 2003) has the description "it is stable in temperature up to 80 degC", it was thought that there was no danger of fire, and it was classified as out of Category.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: No data. In addition, there is that positive the in vitro sister-chromatid-exchange test using a human lymphocytes reports (RTECS (2003)).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: PM (13th, 2003) has the description "it is stable in temperature to 80 degC", and even if it contacts the normal temperature air, it does not ignite spontaneously.

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: In three generations of rat mixed feed administration tests, since the fall of newborn weight, the increase in stillbirth, and decline in the survival rate until weaning were seen (HSDB (2003)), it was set as Category 2. In addition, teratogenicity is not acknowledged (HSDB (2003)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Although there is description that redness and a pain are produced in a human eye in ICSC(J)(1997), irritation is not indicated as effects of short-term exposure. So data is insufficient and it cannot taxonomic.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (the water solubility is obtained)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since tremor, decreased weight gain, and the decreased of cholinesterase activity were observed in four weeks of rat feeding administration test (100 ppm : about 5 to 10 mg/kg/day) (HSDB (2003)), and this dosage was within the guidance value range of Category 1, it was classified into Category 1 (nervous systems). Furthermore, the this product is a cholinesterase inhibitor, and there is description of a possibility that influence will be accumulated (ICSC (J), (1997), SITTIG (4th, 2002)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Since there is description "nervous system may be affected and a spasm and a respiratory failure may be produced" in the document of Priority 2 (ICSC (J) (1997)), and there is a report of the poisoning (vomiting, nausea, and a person with an severe disease fall into a comatose state) by this product (HSDB (2003)), it was considered as Category 2 (nervous system).
